short_summary: Delivery and coordination services for the Stream to Sea program in Nanaimo, Ladysmith area.
description: Fishery resources management service, with no geographical specificity, involving a variety of services including classroom sessions, salmon life cycle, dissections, ecosystem-knowledge, and more, targeting at local and First Nations communities.
full_summary:
### Request for Proposal: Stream to Sea Program Delivery and Coordination Services

#### [English]
Fisheries and Oceans Canada invites contractors to submit proposals for delivery and coordination services to support the Stream to Sea Program across the South Coast region, specifically in Nanaimo, Ladysmith (SD68), and Chemainus (SD79).

The Stream to Sea Program aims to engage external parties in salmon-focused education and bring together community, First Nations, and local groups to support the project. Contractors will be responsible for coordinating and delivering educational sessions in classrooms and working with local stakeholders to develop and implement a spring fry release program.

#### [French]
Pêches et Océans Canada invite les entrepreneurs à soumissionner pour les services de prestation et de coordination pour l'appui du programme Au fil de l'eau dans la région de la côte sud, en particulier à Nanaimo, Ladysmith (SD68) et Chemainus (SD79).

Le programme Au fil de l'eau vise à rassembler des partenaires externes pour partager leur expertise dans le domaine de l'éducation focussée sur le saumon et à encourager la collaboration entre les communautés, les Premières nations et les groupes locaux.

### Service Requirements:

- Coordinate and assist with the setup of classroom aquariums
- Deliver salmon eggs to schools
- Provide classroom sessions on salmon life cycle, dissections, ecosystems, and habitat requirements
- Offer maintenance and troubleshooting support for aquariums
- Develop and deliver a spring fry release program
- Participate in live salmon transport and spawning (if required)

### Notification Details:

* Publication Date: August 16, 2022
* Tender Closing Date: August 31, 2022, 13:00:00
* Contact Information:
  - Claire Lavoie
  - DFOtenders-soumissionsMPO@dfo-mpo.gc.ca
  - (506)282-2340

### Proposal Documents:
You can download the Request for Proposal (RFP) documents in English and French from the Government of Canada Buy and Sell webpage.
